Text:
We proceed through the black void in the direction
magic is being pulled to.
I can't feel anything other than that.

Even the feeling of walking is indistinct, and I lose
all sense of up and down. I try seeing if I can walk
upside-down, lowering my head and raising my
feet like I am doing a handstand.
Hey.
Hmm?
What are you doing?

Oh, I was just thinking how I can't tell up from down
in this place.

Up? Down? Don't go trying to look anywhere you
shouldn't.
I won't.

We continue on for a while longer until we're
suddenly engulfed by light.
Whoa!
Gurgh!
So heavy...
I think you're imagining things.
This is what you get for goofing around, honestly...
We find ourselves on a battlefield.

The soil is stained with the black blood of the
fallen soldiers. The gory scene stretches out
to the horizon.

(A battleground devoid of hope...and onto it,
unbeknownst to all, steps the shadowbroker...)
(Yeah, that works.)
Hm?

Violet looks down at me where I lay on the ground
and extends her hand.
Thanks.
I take her cold hand and get to my feet.
Let's be on our way.

She sets off at a pace as if she knows exactly where
she's going.
The ground is covered with the dead.

We traverse the carnage, treading on the corpses as
we go.

After a while, we come upon a girl crying in the
middle of it all. We stop before her.
I don't need to see her face to know she's Violet.
You're crying again.
I was a crybaby.
Lend me your sword.
Sure.

Violet places herself in front of the girl, the blade
at the ready.

Her face is blank and gives the impression that she
is shoving her emotions off to the side.
Violet swings the sword down.
At that moment, I spring into action.
I grab her and deflect a sword.

The dead soldiers have come to life and tried to
attack Violet. If hadn't jumped in, she would've
been hacked to bits.
How bothersome...
The Sanctuary is rejecting us.

Like we're viruses, and we've triggered the
antivirus software, huh?
I'm afraid I don't get the metaphor.
Sorry, I'm no expert in that stuff either.

But let's say you were to die here. What would
happen?
I suppose that I'd be returned to the initial room.
That would be annoying.
Indeed.
It truly would be...
Yeah...
